p.s: In the given article Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't written by John Worne in The Telegraph on 27 January 2015 the author tells about the problem in the UK that more and more people just know englishEnglish as their only language.
The author tells the number of students in the UK which choose to study an other language than englishEnglish goes significantly down (ll. 3-5).
Also the uptake of languages are stopped (ll. 7-8) and fewer language A-level exams are taken then in 1990 (ll. 9-12).

In the authorsauthor's opinion this is a huge problem because on the one hand not everybody in the world can speak englishEnglish (ll. 12-15) and on the other hand you need more than one language to be successfullsuccessful in the future (ll. 19-23; ll. 27-29).

Admittedly there are some progress like that students should start to learn an other language in primary school (ll. 6-7) or that universities offer students to study a language besides their degree subject (ll. 24-26) but more people should learn another language to safe their future (ll. 30-31) and their parents should help to do something for it (ll. 32-35).
In short the author thinks that in the UK too little young people speak a second language.
So he wants to expand the language learning in schools and universities with the help from other parents because the education system can notcannot fix this alone.
